argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | rhmsubcsetc.c | |- C = ( ExtStrCat ` U ) |
| 2 |  | rhmsubcsetc.u | |- ( ph -> U e. V ) |
| 3 |  | rhmsubcsetc.b | |- ( ph -> B = ( Ring i^i U ) ) |
| 4 |  | rhmsubcsetc.h | |- ( ph -> H = ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) ) |
| 5 | 3 | #P_eleq2d | |- ( ph -> ( x e. B <-> x e. ( Ring i^i U ) ) ) |
| 6 |  | #P_elin | |- ( x e. ( Ring i^i U ) <-> ( x e. Ring /\ x e. U ) ) |
| 7 | 6 | #P_simplbi | |- ( x e. ( Ring i^i U ) -> x e. Ring ) |
| 8 | 5, 7 | #P_syl6bi | |- ( ph -> ( x e. B -> x e. Ring ) ) |
| 9 | 8 | #P_imp | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> x e. Ring ) |
| 10 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Base ` x ) = ( Base ` x ) |
| 11 | 10 | #P_idrhm | |- ( x e. Ring -> ( _I |` ( Base ` x ) ) e. ( x RingHom x ) ) |
| 12 | 9, 11 | #P_syl | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( _I |` ( Base ` x ) ) e. ( x RingHom x ) ) |
| 13 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Id ` C ) = ( Id ` C ) |
| 14 | 2 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> U e. V ) |
| 15 | 6 | #P_simprbi | |- ( x e. ( Ring i^i U ) -> x e. U ) |
| 16 | 5, 15 | #P_syl6bi | |- ( ph -> ( x e. B -> x e. U ) ) |
| 17 | 16 | #P_imp | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> x e. U ) |
| 18 | 1, 13, 14, 17 | #P_estrcid | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( ( Id ` C ) ` x ) = ( _I |` ( Base ` x ) ) ) |
| 19 | 4 | #P_oveqdr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( x H x ) = ( x ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) x ) ) |
| 20 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( RingCat ` U ) = ( RingCat ` U ) |
| 21 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) |
| 22 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) |
| 23 | 20, 21, 2, 22 | #P_ringchomfval | |- ( ph -> ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( RingHom |` ( ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) X. ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) ) ) ) |
| 24 | 20, 21, 2 | #P_ringcbas | |- ( ph -> ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( U i^i Ring ) ) |
| 25 |  | #P_incom | |- ( Ring i^i U ) = ( U i^i Ring ) |
| 26 | 3, 25 | #P_syl6eq | |- ( ph -> B = ( U i^i Ring ) ) |
| 27 | 26 | #P_eqcomd | |- ( ph -> ( U i^i Ring ) = B ) |
| 28 | 24, 27 | #P_eqtrd | |- ( ph -> ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = B ) |
| 29 | 28 | #P_sqxpeqd | |- ( ph -> ( ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) X. ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) ) = ( B X. B ) ) |
| 30 | 29 | #P_reseq2d | |- ( ph -> ( RingHom |` ( ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) X. ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) ) ) = ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) ) |
| 31 | 23, 30 | #P_eqtrd | |- ( ph -> ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) ) |
| 32 | 31 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) ) |
| 33 | 32 | #P_eqcomd | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) = ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) ) |
| 34 | 33 | #P_oveqd | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( x ( RingHom |` ( B X. B ) ) x ) = ( x ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) x ) ) |
| 35 | 26 | #P_eleq2d | |- ( ph -> ( x e. B <-> x e. ( U i^i Ring ) ) ) |
| 36 | 35 | #P_biimpa | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> x e. ( U i^i Ring ) ) |
| 37 | 24 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) = ( U i^i Ring ) ) |
| 38 | 36, 37 | #P_eleqtrrd | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> x e. ( Base ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) ) |
| 39 | 20, 21, 14, 22, 38, 38 | #P_ringchom | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( x ( Hom ` ( RingCat ` U ) ) x ) = ( x RingHom x ) ) |
